page.title: 06NATIONAL GARDEN FESTIVAL1990
page.content: The object of a Garden Festival is to reclaim and landscape a{derelict {site,}turning it into a place of interest which will attract visitors. For the period of the festival(5 or 6 months) the festival park is the venue for{exhibitions of gardening, leisure {pursuits, fun and games.}At the end of the festival some of the land is developed for{housing and light {industry}but much of it remains as{ {park land}for everyone to enjoy. The festival site covers 180 acres of waste land from Dunston coal staithes on the Tyne to Norwood Coke Works on the northern edge of the Team Valley. A fun and games area, exhibition hall,{theme park,}garden centre and a venue for{water events} are planned. Up to 1000 jobs may be created on a permanent basis.
